cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles south of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northeast parallel to the North Carolina coast, then accelerating offshore toward southeastern New England and Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: vicinity of Cape Hatteras / Outer Banks, NC

weather_observation.warning_coast: Edisto Beach to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina and North Carolina coasts, especially from Edisto Beach, SC northward through Cape Hatteras, NC
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with gusts possibly reaching minimal hurricane force during peak squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Residual surge of 2–4 ft above ground possible in and around Charleston Harbor during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain possible, producing flash flooding in low-lying and urban areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, and a low risk of tornadoes embedded in rain bands.
